snippet: A Beijing resident and adherent of the banned Falun Gong movement said he slipped letters into product packages apparently meant for the West.
abstract: Beijing resident identified only as Zhang, member of banned Falun Gong movement, admits to authoring letters that were slipped into packages of Halloween decorations shipped to Oregon from China's Masanjia labor camp; letters were plea for help from inmates, scores of whom have now come forward to corroborate Zhang's descriptions of abuse and torture, especially toward members of Falun Gong, outlawed spiritual practice.
lead_paragraph: A Beijing resident and adherent of the banned Falun Gong movement said he slipped letters into product packages apparently meant for the West.

headline.seo: Man Details Risks in Exposing China’s Forced Labor
headline.main: Behind Cry for Help From China Labor Camp
